reviewText: Great movie with a great story. Saw it on TV and wanted to be able to watch it unscheduled so I purchased it for myself.
Very good movie and arrived quick, helped because I needed it asap for a class that I teach! I would recommend this to anyone as a must watch!
movie is interesting but somewhat predictable.  falls short of expectations.  had to watch movie for a psych class.  wondered why teacher chose this movie.
My daughter ordered this for herself and she really enjoys it. she saw the movie on lifetime and fell in love with it. She and her mother watched it every weekend.

In a word:awful. The script was horrific. There was no character development to speak of. They never even say some of the character's names. As a movie about the foster care system some parts were portrayed accurately, but other aspects were completely wrong.

I first saw this movie on Lifetime network and I have been hooked since. In todays trying times, broken families, and peer pressure, it shows us that all most of these kids need is some compassion, love & understanding. Rosie is incredible in the movie and has even taken steps in her private life to help and adopt. I think if more would take that as an example these kids wouldn't have to 'fall through the cracks and age out'. These kids are in America ... and they are America's children.
Movie was received on time as promised by seller.  No skips or scratches.  Would purchase from this seller again.

This is a wonderful movie (quality and all) that has a beautiful message attached not to spoil the movie but once you have seen this it will become very clear what life is all about. Given that this story is one that is very near and dear to me, I must say that this is a powerful movie and the information that is presented is one that will not be forgotten.

"America" is very dramatic film that portrays the life's potential misery. It covers themes of abuse, suicide, violence, anger, depression, neglect and drug abuse.

It's a very moving film. New comer Philip Johnson, who plays the title character must have a bright future. He is amazing. There are scenes where his responses are monosyllabic or he says nothing yet he says everything. He does an excellent job portraying the pain and misery of of troubled youth.

It was also refreshing to see Rosie O'Donnell taking a serious, non-comedic role. She displays her versatility as an actress in this film as a careering counselor who mentors troubled youth in a foster home, including America.

This film is truly moving it will definitely bring tears to sensitive viewers.

i love this movie as a fan of the book,i was really surprised how good they translated it.
If you do decide to buy this movie believe me you will not regret it.

This inspiring movie delivers a heart-wrenching, intriguing story about the life of a young boy who was abused, and the help he receives from his psychiatrist, played by Rosie O'Donnell. Acting performance is Superb, and the emotional story grabs your attention in the very beginning, as we view the sad life that one young boy lived. With the constant attention and help his psychiatrist gives, the boy finally begins to realize that there is light at the end of the tunnel, as he holds on tight to hope. He winds up burying his horrifying past, as he moves forward to a new beginning. The story makes the viewer realize that there's always hope, and all we have to do is believe. Powerfully moving, riveting, and entertaining from start to finish. Highly recommended!

Such a touching movie sooo meaningful and really mixes your emotions up you feel just about every feeling in a good way

This was an excellent DVD on the life of a kid who was placed in the foster care system; he was a representation of scores of children who face the challenges of being in foster care.  Also, the DVD presentation takes viewers through the internal dilemma he went through after being abused in the foster home he was placed in. This DVD can be an excellent teaching tool for counselors use in helping students to work the same issues America faced. Moreover, the counselors can encourage students to overcome them via the support the character, America, received.

THE MOVIE IS GREAT AND I UNDERSTAND IT WAS AMDE FOR TV, SO IT DID GET TURNED DOWN A BIT WHEN IT CAME TO THE EVENTS THAT HAPPEND BUT OVERALL IT WAS A GREAT RENDITION, AWESOME JOB! READ THE BOOK IF YOU HAVENT!

Absolutely LOVED this movie!  It's point on about our foster system and the trial that each child goes through while in it!
Great movie. I work with foster youth and it has been a great movie to show in groups and then discuss the youth's many different placements and what they have been through.
Excellent movie, very good insight in to the Foster Care system and how it is not working for the kids that it servers.  Movie does give you hope though.  Rosie O'Donnell is excellent in the movie.
